body.p: To the Governor of the Commonwealth of Kentucky.

The undersigned citizens of the county of Caldwell in the state of Kentucky would respectfully state that, John C. Boyd, was indicted in the Caldwell Circuit Court for carrying concealed weapons, that thereupon he with, John R. Boyd as his security entered into a recognizance for the appearance of the said John C. Boyd in said court to answer said charge, that subsequently the said John C. Boyd was engaged for a time in the Federal service, and thereby because so obnoxious to guerillas who were infesting the country, that he deemed it unsafe to remain in the state, that his life was repeatedly threatened by such guerillas and those cooperating with them, and for these reasons he went to the state of Illinois and was absent from the state at the time of court and said recognizance was taken as forfeited, and judgment for fifty dollars was rendered by the Caldwell Circuit Court at its November term 1863 against the said John R. Boyd upon said forfeited recognizance.
And we further state that before said judgment was rendered the said John C. Boyd surrendered himself in said court to answer said charge, and he is now recognized to answer same.
And we also state that the said John R. Boyd and John C. Boyd are both poor men, with families, relying mainly upon their exertions for a living. Wherefore we ask that said judgment may be remitted.

S. Marble
John R Boyd
D. W. McGoodwin
N. B. Ratliff
P. W. McCoy
J. N. Turner
E P Campbell
Comths attorney
John Wheatly
Wm Cash
J P Gracey
R. L. Wilson
James C. Barnes
I believe from the evidence introduced on the trial of above named cause that the above Petition Setsforth Substantially the facts if in the premises

Please enclose to D. W. McGoodwin
Princeton, Ky.

Caldwell Cir Ct
vs
J R Boyd
$50 --
Forfeited
12th Jany/64

Remit all -- except fees & costs
Tho E Bramlette
